content:
I'll get this digression out from under the Consumer Reports thread

Chris Moesel said:

A co-worker shared with me the guidance she was given on hand-washing: Wash your hands like you just diced a jalapeno and now you have to put your contacts in.

Although I have zero experience at slicing jalapenos, and no contact lenses, I have been harmed by jalapenos in my mouth, so I can easily get the message by imagining that I've just been slicing them when I realize I need to use the loo. THAT would cause me to be careful and thorough.
true story: i sliced jalapenos on saturday, clearly didn't wash my hands properly, and managed to touch my eye as I ate breakfast. sigh.
Oh no! Are you in a 2 week quarantine now?
